overview.title: Hydraulic Situation Overview
overview.description: Analysis of the historic recovery following the Sept 2025 - Jan 2026 rainfall season. Data aggregated from the Ministry of Equipment and Water.

charts.analysis: After hitting a critical low of 23.2% in 2024, reserves have shown a V-shaped recovery. The 2026 level (55.2%) surpasses the 2021-2022 average, officially ending the "7-year drought" cycle according to the Ministry.

regional.title: Regional Situation
regional.northDesc: Loukkos & Bouregreg > 90%. Dams like Oued El Makhazine are full. Secure for 3 years.
regional.centerDesc: Sebou at 68.7%. Al Wahda (largest dam) holding 2.6B m³. Agriculture secure.
regional.southDesc: Oum Er Rbia rose from 4.7% to 30.5%. Al Massira dam revived (13%). Crisis averted but caution needed.

dams.title: Major Dams Detailed Status (Top 10 by Capacity)
dams.name: Dam Name
dams.showing: Displaying top 8 dams by strategic importance.

footer.title: Morocco Dams Monitor
footer.description: A dedicated platform providing real-time data visualization of the Kingdom's hydraulic resources. Monitoring the 2026 water recovery efforts.
footer.waterSavingDesc: Despite the recovery, water conservation remains a national priority.
footer.copyright: © 2026 Water Security Monitor. Designed with AI.

news.news3: Oued El Makhazine and Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdellah dams releasing excess water
news.news4: Sebou-Bouregreg Water Highway transferred 400M m³ this winter
